tables.caption: Features & Benefits Available with Both Simple Advantage and Custom Advantage

rows.value: Home and Community Care

Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services including Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care
Facility Care
Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility
Elimination Period
100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative
Alternate Service Provision

A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for OLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.
Bed Reservation
Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason
Return of Premium
If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate
International Benefit

Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA is limited to the lesser of: (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured is in the U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit is doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added to policy: International Benefit is modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days
Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse

Limited coverage if the insured's policy ends due to non-payment of premiums, or the insured's written request to cancel, following a substantial premium increase; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Total benefits paid to the insured will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to the nonforfeiture date
Initial Needs Assessment

1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured; If Care Management organization is selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime
Premium Waiver
Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits
Coordination of Benefits
Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare (COB and non-duplication of coverage not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider)
Payment Options

Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider – available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact the tax deductibility of the premium; consult tax advisor
Care Coordination Services

MetLife Care Coordinators are available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts in the insured's area. An insured can also call for advice about caring for a loved one who needs LTC services, even if their family member is not insured with MetLife.
Discounts
30% Spousal** + – 15% Marital** – 15% Residential – 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84) – 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases
Underwriting Classes
Preferred (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84), Standard & Substandard (Always quote Standard!)
Save Age
Premium based on age 30 days prior to application date (underwriting requirements based on age at date of signed application)
Policy Effective Dates
With Premium (Conditional Receipt may apply): Date all underwriting requirements are met; Without Premium: 28 days following underwriting approval date
Free Look Period
Insured has 30 days to review policy and if desired, return it for a full refund
Policy Delivery
Policy Delivery Receipt (PDR) must be signed within 30 days of Policy Approval Date
